summary: Community organizations can get Head Start grants to provide education and other early childhood services to children in poverty. If a community loses its grant recipient, another organization provides services temporarily. But parents have raised concerns about the quality of these interim services. We found that the Office of Head Start didn't always monitor programs to assess whether they met child safety and other standards...
title: Head Start: Action Needed to Reduce Potential Risks to Children and Federal Funds in Programs under Interim Management
